sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Outrage among European Union leaders as the news Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny had died on Friday while imprisoned in a Russian prison colony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky prepares for his visit to France and Germany while Washington warns Moscow troops are making headway in Avdiivka.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thousands of Italian farmers rally in the streets of Rome to protest against EU rules regarding the agricultural industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The death of Alexei Navalny sparked outrage and indignation in the European Union and everyone blames the same person, Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, says the Russian president fears nothing more than dissent from his own people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Roberta Mitzola, president of the European Parliament, calls him a fighter whose courage will echo through generations, stating that Russia took his freedom and his life, but not his dignity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: EU President Charles Michel holds the Russian regime solely responsible for the death of the Russian dissident who fought for the values of freedom and democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Members of the European Parliament are also on the same page. With Navalny has died one of our last hopes to have a relation between a democratic Russia and our Europe. And that's what we all wanted in the past.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: With him goes this opportunity. Unfortunately, it's a very sad occasion also for us Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Alexei Navalny was given the Sakharov Prize for Freedom of Thought, the highest honour from the European Parliament in 2021, whilst he was in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: His daughter, Daria Navalnia, accepted the prize on his behalf.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced on Thursday the creation of a, quote,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: new security architecture in his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While it is unsure what that would entail, the declaration comes ahead of his visits to Germany and France on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: During his trip, the Ukrainian leader is expected to sign bilateral security agreements with Paris. Meanwhile, the White House warned that Moscow was beginning to overwhelm Ukrainian forces in Avdiivka.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: I want to share a few words about the battlefield situation in Ukraine, where the fighting is incredibly intense in the east, particularly in a city called Avdiivka.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's a city that we've talked about several times before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, we're getting reports from the Ukrainians that the situation is critical, with the Russians continuing to press Ukrainian positions every single day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Avdiivka is at risk of falling into Russian control. The Russian military has pressed attacks in several sectors in a bid to drain Kiev's reserves and deplete its ammunitions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For months, the action has focused on Avdiivka.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The city is seen as a gateway to the Russian-held regional capital of Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg stated that NATO does not see any immediate threat of military attacks on a NATO member,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: but noted that there is a constant risk of hybrid attacks. The Institute for the Study of War has recently observed Kremlin actors, including Russian President Vladimir Putin, setting informational conditions to justify possible Russian hybrid attacks on Moldova as well as the Baltic states, Denmark and Finland. In its latest assessment, the US-based think tank says the Kremlin is conducting information operations against Moldova very similar to those that the Kremlin used before its invasions of Ukraine in 2014 and 2022 likely to set conditions to justify possible future Russian escalation against Moldova although the timing of a possible Russian hybrid operation there is unclear the Kremlin is setting informational conditions to make it possible soon earlier the Estonian foreign intelligence service stated that the Russian military's ongoing restructuring and expansion effort aims to intensify Russian military's posturing against Finland and the wider NATO alliance the VLA reported that the Russian military is forming the Leningrad Military District and Moscow Military District in order to posture against Finland and NATO while also attempting to, quote, partially strengthen its units in the Baltic region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The VLA's assessment is consistent with the Institute for the Study of War's assessment that Russia may be arranging military assets in a way to posture along the border with nato members in the meet too long term the estonian foreign intelligence service says the likelihood of a direct military attack against estonia remains low this year but the security situation in europe and along estonia's borders in the near future depends on whether Ukraine, with the support of its allies, can shatter Russia's aggression.

sentences.sentence: Patients in beds lined the corridors of the Nasser medical complex in Gaza on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It is the main hospital in the southern part of the Strip, stormed by IDF forces earlier in the day, killing at least four patients and wounding several others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Israeli army said it was a limited operation seekingages were kept in the hospital and that their remains might still be inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: If it weren't for Hamas starting this war, taking our hostages and hiding in the hospital, we wouldn't need to be in the hospital in the first place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Hamas started this war, Israel will end this war." Satellite images show Egypt building a wall and leveling land near its border with the Gaza Strip, ahead of a planned Israeli offensive targeting the border town of Rafah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Greek parliament on Thursday approved the legislation of same-sex civil marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Polls showed that the majority of Greeks were in favor of the bill drawn up by the center-right government and supported by four left-wing parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Greek Orthodox Church was against it. Today is a day of joy, because from tomorrow, a fragment between us is being removed, to become a bridge of coexistence in a free state, with free citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The bill grants full parental rights on married same-sex partners with children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Yet it precludes gay couples from parenthood through surrogate mothers in Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The issue has divided Greeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: LGBTQI plus organizations have led the marches in support of the bill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Not one, but three rallies were staged by Italian farmers in Rome on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Over a thousand of them flocked to the Italian capital from across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The crowd group was the main organizer of the protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They don't identify with any unions and are against Brussels' rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They traveled to the Italian capital to deliver their message to the European Commission.

sentences.sentence: Last week, a mural was discovered by a family doing renovation works on their old house in Ghent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They thought the artwork could have been a genuine piece from the Dutch master, as the details were strikingly similar to his works.
